definition: gangway/ramp (to board a ship or plane)
side of a ship or an aircraft

sentences.english: As well, there may be more server shuffling as Classic ramps down.
sentences.chinese: 必须有也许是更多服务器拖曳象经典舷梯下来。

sentences.english: Two aluminium alloy stanchions for accommodation ladder were lacked, to be provided.
sentences.chinese: 舷梯两面没有铅合金支柱，请提供。

sentences.english: Two aluminium alloy stanchions for acmodation ladder were lacked, to be provided.
sentences.chinese: 舷梯两面没有铅合金支柱，请提供。

sentences.english: I am the sailor on duty, our captain has asked me to meet you here at the gangway.
sentences.chinese: 我是值班水手，我们的船长让我在舷梯口接你。

sentences.english: The president waved to the crowd from the steps of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 总统在飞机舷梯上向人群挥手致意。

sentences.english: Please lower the gangway a little bit.
Foreign Minister Fahmy was barely discernible at the bottom of the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 外交部长法赫米站在舷梯下面，隐约可见。

sentences.english: Duty officer, please lift the gangway and let the shore crane pass by, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 值班副，请升一下舷梯让桥吊通过一下，谢谢。

sentences.english: Jews passed the store hand to hand up the gangway.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人把货物传递到舷梯。

sentences.english: Wait a moment! I'll ask the sailor on duty to see you to the gangway.
sentences.chinese: 等一下，我让值班水手送你到舷梯口。

sentences.english: Angolan Prime Minister Fernando da Piedade Dias dos Santos welcomed the Chinese Premier in front of the cabinet ladder.
sentences.chinese: 安哥拉总理费尔南多在舷梯前迎接。

sentences.english: Prime Minister Helen Clark and other senior officials of New Zealand waited at the accommodation ladder of the plane to greet him.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰总理克拉克携新方高级官员在舷梯旁热情迎候。

sentences.english: They advanced up the gangway and gained the deck.

definition: sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
the bow or prow of a ship
